page.title: 10MARBURY PARK, CHESHIRE.
page.content: Marbury Park has been set aside as a place for people to relax and enjoy the pleasures of the countryside. Once there was a Hall but it fell into such a state of disrepair that it had to be pulled down. During the War, the park was used as a prisoner-of-war camp and later fell into neglect. Some years ago, it was taken over by the Local Authority which has restored it to its present state, providing bird and animal sanctuaries, observation hides and picnic areas. Marbury is becoming increasingly well-known for the wide variety of its wild life and is a favourite place for walks and picnics. The park also contains an open-air Swimming Baths which is open from May to September. The average temperature is 68%F, a minimum of 54%F in May and September and a maximum of 76%F in July.
